did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: Collection contains correspondence, minute books, and financial records for organizations within the Valley Street Baptist Church in Abingdon, Virginia.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Valley Street Baptist Church Records must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Valley Street Baptist Church Records, Ms2011-069, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Valley Street Baptist Church Records was completed in August 2011.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Young People's Conference of the Valley Street Baptist Church in Abingdon, VA was formed in July 1934 as an organization through which the youth could get more involved in the church organization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of correspondence, minutes, and financial information for the Valley Street Baptist Church Young People's Conference. These records date from 1934 through 1937. The correspondence includes a letter from Mary McLeod Bethune, Director of the Division of Negro Affairs for the National Youth Administration. The collection also includes minutes and financial records for Sunday School meetings and the Finance committee.
